name: Enable encryption at rest using AWS KMS Customer Managed Key (CMK) for Elasticsearch domains
description: Ensure all data stored in the Elasticsearch domains is encrypted at rest using AWS KMS Customer Managed Keys (CMKs). This provides an additional layer of security and control over the encryption keys.

name: Enable node-to-node encryption for Elasticsearch domains
description: Enable node-to-node encryption for all Elasticsearch domains to ensure that data is encrypted in transit between nodes within the Elasticsearch cluster.

name: Enable fine-grained access control for Elasticsearch domains
description: Ensure AWS Elasticsearch/OpenSearch fine-grained access control is enabled for all domains. This feature provides granular control over data access and operations within the Elasticsearch cluster.

name: Enable audit logging for Elasticsearch domains
description: Enable audit logging for all Elasticsearch domains to track and monitor user activities, including authentication attempts, access to indices, and document-level operations.

name: Enforce HTTPS for all Elasticsearch domain endpoints
description: Ensure that all Elasticsearch domain endpoints enforce HTTPS connections to encrypt data in transit and prevent man-in-the-middle attacks.

name: Configure Elasticsearch domains with at least three dedicated master nodes
description: Ensure Elasticsearch domains are configured with at least three dedicated master nodes for high availability and improved cluster stability.

name: Deploy Elasticsearch domains within a VPC
description: Ensure that all Elasticsearch domains are deployed within a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) to enhance network isolation and security.

name: Use custom security groups for Elasticsearch domains
description: Ensure that Elasticsearch domains use custom security groups instead of the default security group. Configure these security groups with minimal necessary inbound and outbound rules.

name: Use latest TLS policy for Elasticsearch domains
description: Verify and ensure that all Elasticsearch domains are using the most up-to-date TLS policy to maintain strong encryption for data in transit.

name: Enable error logging for Elasticsearch domains
description: Enable error logging for all Elasticsearch domains to capture and monitor error events, facilitating troubleshooting and performance optimization.

name: Implement IP-based access control for Elasticsearch domains
description: Configure IP-based access control policies for Elasticsearch domains to restrict access to specific IP ranges or CIDR blocks, enhancing security by limiting potential attack surfaces.

name: Enable automated snapshots for Elasticsearch domains
description: Enable automated snapshots for all Elasticsearch domains to ensure regular backups of cluster data, facilitating disaster recovery and data protection.

name: Implement least privilege access for Elasticsearch domains
description: Ensure that IAM policies for Elasticsearch domains follow the principle of least privilege, granting only the necessary permissions to authorized entities for specific operations and resources.

name: Enable UltraWarm storage for Elasticsearch domains
description: Enable UltraWarm storage for Elasticsearch domains that require cost-effective storage for less frequently accessed data while maintaining fast query performance.

name: Configure cross-cluster search for Elasticsearch domains
description: Set up cross-cluster search for Elasticsearch domains that require querying data across multiple clusters, ensuring proper security configurations and access controls are in place.
